titleInfo.title: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 725, INNOCENT PARTY PROTECTION ACT

extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 725, INNOCENT PARTY PROTECTION ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 40

congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Amending title 28, United States Code, to prevent fraudulent joinder_
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Rule for Consideration: The House agreed to H. Res. 175, providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 725) to amend title 28, United States Code, to prevent fraudulent joinder, by a recorded vote of 235 ayes to 185 noes, Roll No. 130, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 230 yeas to 184 nays, Roll No. 129.

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Amending title 28, United States Code, to prevent fraudulent joinder_
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Rule for Consideration: The House agreed to H. Res. 175, providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 725) to amend title 28, United States Code, to prevent fraudulent joinder, by a recorded vote of 235 ayes to 185 noes, Roll No. 130, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 230 yeas to 184 nays, Roll No. 129.

titleInfo.title: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 1301, DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE APPROPRIATIONS ACT, 2017

extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 1301, DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE APPROPRIATIONS ACT, 2017; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 40

congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 1301, making appropriations for the Department of Defense for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2017, by a yea-and-nay vote of 371 yeas to 48 nays, Roll No. 136.<P/>H. Res. 174, the rule providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1301) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 233 ayes to 185 noes, Roll No. 133, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 232 yeas to 189 nays, Roll No. 131.

extension.searchTitle: MOTION TO ADJOURN; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 40

congVote.result: So the motion to adjourn was rejected.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Rejected the Hoyer motion to adjourn by a recorded vote of 127 ayes to 295 noes with 1 answering ``present'', Roll No. 132.

titleInfo.title: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 1301, DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE APPROPRIATIONS ACT, 2017

extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 1301, DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE APPROPRIATIONS ACT, 2017; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 40

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 1301, making appropriations for the Department of Defense for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2017, by a yea-and-nay vote of 371 yeas to 48 nays, Roll No. 136.<P/>H. Res. 174, the rule providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1301) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 233 ayes to 185 noes, Roll No. 133, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 232 yeas to 189 nays, Roll No. 131.

extension.searchTitle: PARLIAMENTARY INQUIRY; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 40

congVote.result: So the motion to adjourn was rejected.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Rejected the McGovern motion to adjourn by a recorded vote of 107 ayes to 277 noes, Roll No. 134.

congVote.result: The joint resolution (H.J. Res. 58) was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: <P/>By 59 yeas to 40 nays (Vote No. 83), Senate passed H.J. Res. 58, providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Department of Education relating to teacher preparation issues.
